text: Nososticta taracumbi is a species of Australian damselfly in the family Platycnemididae, commonly known as a Melville Island threadtail. It is endemic to Melville Island, Northern Territory, where it inhabits streams. Nososticta taracumbi is a small, slender damselfly, coloured black with bright blue and white markings in the male, and ochre-like colouring in the female. Wings have a brown-yellowish tinge. ==Gallery== Nososticta taracumbi female wings (34664268882).jpg | Female wings Nososticta taracumbi male wings (34787472906).jpg | Male wings ==See also== * List of Odonata species of Australia == References == Category:Platycnemididae Category:Odonata of Australia Category:Insects of Australia Category:Endemic fauna of Australia Category:Taxa named by J.A.L. title: Nososticta taracumbi
